title: Synchrophasor Data Analysis for Oscillation Detection
description: An engineer analyzes high-speed synchrophasor (PMU) data to detect potentially harmful oscillations on the power grid.

tasks.description: Stream and process real-time PMU data from multiple locations on the grid.
tasks.expected_outcome: System is ingesting and time-aligning the PMU data.

tasks.description: Apply a signal processing algorithm (like the Prony method) to the data to identify any poorly damped electromechanical oscillations.
tasks.expected_outcome: The algorithm detects a low-frequency oscillation between two groups of power plants.

tasks.description: Alert the system operator to the oscillation and recommend tuning a power system stabilizer on a specific generator to add damping and resolve the issue.
tasks.expected_outcome: Engineer provides an actionable recommendation to the operator.
